item.title: Endotracheal Tubes - Types, Features, and Clinical Uses
item.description:
In this episode of Airway Unplugged, we dive deep into the essential tool of airway management: the endotracheal tube (ETT). Whether you're just learning the ropes or need a solid refresher, we break down everything from standard vs. specialty tubes to pediatric considerations and surgical applications.
We’ll explore:
• The differences between oral, nasal, cuffed, and uncuffed ETTs • Why tube design—like RAE, reinforced, or microlaryngeal—matters for specific procedures • Special cases like laser-resistant tubes, Endotrol, and double-lumen ETTs for lung isolation • Key tips for choosing the right tube for children • Real-world pearls to avoid common pitfalls in the OR
From PVC to stainless steel, from Murphy eyes to bronchial blockers—this episode is your fast-track guide to mastering the tube that defines modern anesthesia.
Tune in to sharpen your skills and upgrade your airway game. Because in anesthesia, the tube tells the story.
